intro: Pedicularis brachycrania, commonly known as the short-headed monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic growth habit. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers that are typically pink or reddish in color, with a distinctive hood-like structure. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its specialized ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
